title:
Hypercyclic subspaces for sequences of finite order differential
  operators
authors:
L. Bernal-Gonz\'alez, M.C. Calder\'on-Moreno, J. L\'opez-Salazar and
  J.A. Prado-Bassas
abstract:
It is proved that, if $(P_n)$ is a sequence of polynomials with complex
coefficients having unbounded valences and tending to infinity at sufficiently
many points, then there is an infinite dimensional closed subspace of entire
functions, as well a dense $\mathfrak{c}$-dimensional subspace of entire
functions, all of whose nonzero members are hypercyclic for the corresponding
sequence $(P_n(D))$ of differential operators. In both cases, the subspace can
be chosen so as to contain any prescribed hypercylic function.
